articles.title: Kim Jong Un Meets Women Soccer Players
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Meets Women Soccer Players
Pyongyang, July 31 (KCNA) -- Marshal Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, first chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, met the women soccer players who won the 2013 East Asian Cup. 
					Present at the meeting were Choe Ryong Hae, Jang Song Thaek, Kim Kyong Hui, Kang Sok Ju, Ri Yong Su, Ri Yong Gil, Pak Thae Song, Hwang Pyong So, Kim Pyong Ho, Kim Yong Hun, Ma Won Chun, Kim Yong Chol, O Kum Chol, Ri Jong Mu, minister of Physical Culture and Sports, Ri Ju Bong, chief secretary of the party committee of the ministry, and Jon Yong Nam, chairman of the Central Committee of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League. 
					
					Kim Jong Un shook hands with the players and Chief Coach Kim Kwang Min one by one, warmly congratulating them on the success they made at the 2013 East Asian Cup, exalting the honor of Songun Korea.
					
					He highly praised the distinguished successes made by Kim Un Ju, winner of the prize of best player, Ho Un Byol, winner of the prize of top scorer, and Chief Coach Kim Kwang Min, who led the team to victory. 
					
					The women soccer players of the DPRK fully displayed the Juche-oriented methods of playing and their high techniques, persevering spirit and teamwork, he said, repeatedly appreciating their feats. 
					
					By winning the cup on the day, the 60th anniversary of the victory in the great Fatherland Liberation War, they added joy and jubilation to the servicepersons and people of the country significantly celebrating July 27 and instilled into them confidence of sure victory and optimism, he said. To emerge a winner and let the flag of the DPRK fly in international football games has great appeal and influence stronger than thousands of words in arousing all the service personnel and people to feats in their work. 
					
					"As our country has a tradition in women's soccer and it has a good chance of success, it is important to channel big efforts and direct deep attention to further developing the female soccer so as to produce many soccer stars like Ri Kum Suk, who earned fame in international games," he added.
					
					He once again highly appreciated their successes before presenting gifts to them. 
					
					He expressed belief that they would as ever exalt the honor of the country by winning gold medals in international games. He had a photo taken with them.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Watches Men's Soccer Match
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Watches Men's Soccer Match
Pyongyang, July 31 (KCNA) -- Marshal Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, first chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, watched a men's soccer match between the April 25 Team and the Hwaebul Team.
					Among the spectators were Choe Ryong Hae, Jang Song Thaek, Kim Kyong Hui, Kang Sok Ju, Ri Yong Su, Ri Yong Gil, Pak Thae Song, Hwang Pyong So, Kim Pyong Ho, Kim Yong Hun, Ma Won Chun, Kim Yong Chol, O Kum Chol, Ri Jong Mu, minister of Physical Culture and Sports, Ri Ju Bong, chief secretary of the party committee of the ministry and Jon Yong Nam, chairman of the Central Committee of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League.
					
					The Hwaebul Team took the initiative from the beginning of the match and intensified the attack.
					
					When the team went over to a surprise counterattack from defense, forward Kim Yong Gwang scored the first goal in the 27th minute of the first half.
					
					The April 25 Team made all-out attack, not loosing confidence. It finally managed to score equalizer with back Ji Kwang Hyok making a precise shot amid a mess in the goal area.
					
					The Hwaebul Team trounced its rival by scoring two more goals in the eleven meter penalty kick.
					
					Kim Jong Un expressed great satisfaction over the nice match and congratulated them on their success in the match.
					
					He praised the Hwaebul Team belonging to the Central Committee of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League for its good job. He personally went down to the field and had a photo taken with the team.
					
					He said that the young people should take the lead in raising hot sports wind, too, as the country will be alive when the youth league goes dynamic. 
					
					Stressing the great importance of soccer in exalting the honor of the country, he said it is necessary to round off the soccer techniques, tactics and training methods of Korean style and put them on a higher scientific basis in order to develop soccer. 
					
					He said that what is important for developing soccer is to find out more reserves for players, underscoring the need to build a well-regulated training system, push ahead with the training tenaciously and frequently organize matches among schools at all levels in particular.
					
					He also underlined the need to increase public concern and state assistance for soccer, calling on officials to pay deep attention to it.
					
					He expressed his belief that the sportspersons would perform their duty and mission for bringing sports events including soccer to the world level as they instill confidence and optimism about sure victory into the army and people.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Enjoys Archery Games
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Enjoys Archery Games
Pyongyang, July 31 (KCNA) -- Marshal Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, first chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, watched archery games between the April 25 Defense Sports Team and the Amnokgang Defence Sports Team. 
					Among the spectators were Choe Ryong Hae, Jang Song Thaek, Kim Kyong Hui, Kang Sok Ju, Ri Yong Su, Ri Yong Gil, Pak Thae Song, Hwang Pyong So, Kim Pyong Ho, Kim Yong Hun, Ma Won Chun, Kim Yong Chol, O Kum Chol, Ri Jong Mu, minister of Physical Culture and Sports, Ri Ju Bong, chief secretary of the party committee of the ministry, and Jon Yong Nam, chairman of the Central Committee of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League.
					
					Kim Jong Un watched women's team, mixed team and women's individual events. 
					
					Kim Jong Un praised archers whenever arrows hit the bull's eye. 
					
					The archers of the April 25 Defense Sports Team won the games. 
					
					He praised the archers of the April 25 Defense Sports Team for proving successful at archery. Mental power of the players is important for winning world championship in the archery as is the case with other sports events, he said, stressing the need to motivate the mental power of players so that they may play matches to exalt the honor of the country. 
					
					He said great efforts should be directed to archery as it is quite possible for the DPRK's archers to win international games including Olympics. 
					
					He underscored the need to round off archery techniques of Korean style and scientific training methods and fully ensure training conditions. 
					
					He told officials to pay deep attention to archery and take measures to provide best bows, arrows and other apparatuses to the archers.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Sends Birthday Spread to Centenarian
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Sends Birthday Spread to Centenarian
Pyongyang, July 31 (KCNA) -- Marshal Kim Jong Un sent a birthday spread to Pyon Jang Phae, a centenarian who lives in Suphung workers' district, Sakju County of North Phyongan Province.
					She was born as a daughter of a tenant before the liberation of the country. She was subject to all sorts of maltreatment and contempt as a member of a stateless nation. She could lead a worthy life only after President Kim Il Sung liberated the country.
					
					She worked hard to repay even a bit the care shown by the Workers' Party of Korea. She still keeps herself in good health thanks to the socialist healthcare system.
					
					She often asks her children to do more things for the country, saying she owes her longevity to the loving care of the mother party.

articles.title: Wreaths Laid before Statue, Grave of Kang Pan Sok
articles.content:
Wreaths Laid before Statue, Grave of Kang Pan Sok
Pyongyang, July 31 (KCNA) -- Wreaths were placed before the statue of Kang Pan Sok, an indomitable revolutionary fighter and outstanding leader of the women's movement in Korea, at the Chilgol Revolutionary Site in Pyongyang and her grave in Mangyongdae, the birthplace of President Kim Il Sung, on Wednesday on the occasion of the 81st anniversary of her demise.
					Seen standing before the statue and grave were wreaths sent by Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK), first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army (KPA).
					
					Present at the wreath-laying ceremonies were Jang Jong Nam, Choe Thae Bok, Yang Hyong Sop and other senior officials, the chairperson of a friendly party, officials of party and power bodies, working people's organizations, ministries and national institutions, service personnel of the KPA, officials of various organs and Pyongyangites.
					
					Wreaths were laid before the statue and grave in the name of the Central Committee of the WPK, the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly and Cabinet of the DPRK.
					
					Wreaths were also placed in the name of working people's organizations, ministries, military academies, revolutionary schools and party and power organs and farms in Pyongyang.
					
					The participants paid silent tribute to Kang Pan Sok, looking back on the revolutionary life of her who brought up Kim Il Sung as the sun of the nation and dedicated her all to the struggle for liberating the country and ushered in a new era in the women's movement in Korea.

articles.title: Families of Those Related to Anti-Japanese Revolutionary Struggle Leave
articles.content:
Families of Those Related to Anti-Japanese Revolutionary Struggle Leave
Pyongyang, July 31 (KCNA) -- Families of Chai Shiying, Liu Tongshi, Hu Zhenyi, Jiang Zihua, Fan Delin, Liu Hanxing, Zhang Shoujian and Wang Minggui,  Chinese related to the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle, families of So Sun Ok, Korean anti-Japanese revolutionary fighter in China, families of Pak Kil Song and Kim Chol, Korean anti-Japanese revolutionary martyrs in China, families of Ri Min, Ryang Song Ryong, Kim Sun Ok and Kim Son, Koreans related to the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle in China, and family of Son Won Tae, overseas Korean related to the revolutionary activities of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il, left here on Wednesday.

articles.title: Chinese Delegations Leave
articles.content:
Chinese Delegations Leave
Pyongyang, July 31 (KCNA) -- The delegation of war veterans of the Chinese People's Volunteers (CPV) headed by Yu Zhenwu, former commander of the Air Force of the Chinese People's Liberation Army (CPLA), and the literary and art delegation of the CPLA headed by Li Xiubao, deputy head of the Publicity Department of the General Political Department of the CPLA, left here for home on Wednesday after taking part in the celebrations of the 60th anniversary of the victory in the Fatherland Liberation War.

articles.title: Delegation of Korean War Veterans of Russia Leaves
articles.content:
Delegation of Korean War Veterans of Russia Leaves
Pyongyang, July 31 (KCNA) -- The delegation of Korean war veterans of Russia led by Ya. V. Kanov, vice-chairman of the Korean War Veterans' Council of Russia, left here for home on Wednesday after taking part in the celebrations of the 60th anniversary of the victory in the Fatherland Liberation War.

articles.title: War Veteran Delegates Leave
articles.content:
War Veteran Delegates Leave
Pyongyang, July 31 (KCNA) -- War veteran delegates left here on Wednesday after taking part in the celebrations of the 60th anniversary of the victory in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					After inviting them to Pyongyang, Marshal Kim Jong Un made sure that they attended the military parade and Pyongyang city mass demonstration and other grand celebrations, had a photo session with them and gave them gifts.
					
					Through the celebrations the war veteran delegates came to have firm conviction that remaining loyal to the leadership of Kim Jong Un is the way of glorifying the history and tradition of the victory in the Songun revolution and bringing earlier the rosy future of Songun Korea.
					
					Pyongyangites warmly sent off the victors in the great annals on streets.
					
					Officials of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea and other officials concerned sent off war veteran delegates at railway station.

articles.title: Pak Pong Ju Makes Field Survey of Farms
articles.content:
Pak Pong Ju Makes Field Survey of Farms
Pyongyang, July 31 (KCNA) -- Pak Pong Ju, premier of the DPRK Cabinet, made a field survey of farming in Songchon County, South Phyongan Province.
					Going round the township co-operative farm in Songchon County, he encouraged the agricultural workers there who are making efforts to do good farming despite bad weather during the rainy season.
					
					Then he had a consultative meeting.
					
					The meeting referred to the successes being made by the farm in its efforts to increase the grain production and discussed practical measures for boosting the per-hectare yield.
					
					Learning about the crop conditions on the Taebong Co-operative Farm, he called on the agricultural workers to fulfill their duty with a strong sense of responsible for farming.
					
					After acquainting himself with the application of fertilizers by the farm, he underlined the need to boost the production of quality organic fertilizer, give full play to the advantages of the sub-workteam management system and thus raise the enthusiasm of the farmers and boost the grain production.

articles.title: Women's Union Members Mark Anniversary of Law on Sex Equality
articles.content:
Women's Union Members Mark Anniversary of Law on Sex Equality
Pyongyang, July 31 (KCNA) -- Members of the Democratic Women's Union of Korea from different parts of the country had folk and amusement games at the Moranbong Pleasure Ground on Tuesday and Wednesday. They marked the 67th anniversary of the promulgation of the Law on Sex Equality.
					Present there were Ro Song Sil, chairwoman of the Central Committee of the union, officials and members of the union from Pyongyang and every province.
					
					Women competed in yut-game, swinging and seesawing events. Through the games the participants showcased the high revolutionary spirit of the Korean women to add glory to the immortal exploits of Generalissimos for the development of Juche-based women's movement and perform their duty in the general offensive of building a thriving socialist nation under the wise Songun leadership of the dear respected Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					The Pyongyang team came the first in the team standings.
					
					There was a ceremony of awarding prizes to successful participants.

articles.title: So Ko Jong, Literary Man of Ancient Korea
articles.content:
So Ko Jong, Literary Man of Ancient Korea
Pyongyang, July 31 (KCNA) -- So Ko Jong (1420-1488) was a literary man in the period of the Feudal Joson (Korea) Dynasty (1392-1910), who made contributions to the development of progressive poetry.
					Born into an aristocrat's family, he engaged himself in studies in his early years. 
					
					He passed a literature exam in 1444 and began working as a government official whose job was to select reserve bureaucrats.
					
					He played a key role in compiling "Kyonggukdaejon", code of the Feudal Joson Dynasty, in 1470 and compiled "Tongmunson" (133 vols.), a collection of poems, in 1478
					
					He wrote "Korean Geography" (50 vols.) in 1481 and compiled "Tonginsihwa", a collection of critiques, which dealt with the poems well known until the 15th Century. 
					
					In the collection, he was critical of the poems with no idea and cautioned against me-tooism in creating poems.

articles.title: Japan Takes Away Great Quantities of Koryo Insam from Korea
articles.content:
Japan Takes Away Great Quantities of Koryo Insam from Korea
Pyongyang, July 31 (KCNA) -- For decades of their colonial rule over Korea, the Japanese imperialists plundered the country of Koryo insam (ginseng), one of its specialties.
					The Japanese had long tried to cultivate insam on their soil but in vain.
					
					After the emergence of "Korea-Japan Defence Provisions", called "Kanghwa Island Treaty", in 1876, an endless stream of Japanese sailed to Korea in groups to steal insam. Their robbery was done with the support of arms.
					
					The Japanese even practiced smuggling of hongsam (steamed-and-dried insam), the export of which was prohibited by the Feudal Joson (Korea) Dynasty (1392-1910). They stole the hongsam manufacturing technique from Korea to produce hongsam in secret and sell them to China as Korea's.
					
					They annually plundered 600 kilograms of hongsam, getting profit of 15,000 won.
					
					At the beginning of its colonial rule, the Japanese government-general deprived the Korean royal government of its right to monopoly of insam, the nation's major revenue.
					
					The Japanese invaders even had insam products named after the Japanese government-general, thus stripping Korea of the trademark right for insam.
					
					Japan looted at least 11.58 million kilograms of Koryo insam between 1911 and 1942 alone.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Slams S. Korea's Moves to Defer Transfer of Right to Command Wartime Operations
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Slams S. Korea's Moves to Defer Transfer of Right to Command Wartime Operations
Pyongyang, July 31 (KCNA) -- A south Korean media shortly ago reported that puppet Minister of Defense of south Korea Kim Kwan Jin officially proposed the deferment of the transfer of the right to command wartime operations at the talks with the U.S. Defense secretary in June last. The south Korean military also confirmed it proposed discussing the matter at the meeting of the south Korea-U.S. "annual consultative council" to be held in October.
					Rodong Sinmun Wednesday in a commentary says:
					
					The south Korean military's moves to defer the transfer of the right to command wartime operations saliently reveal the treacherous nature of the south Korean ruling quarters keen on confrontation with fellow countrymen, backed by foreign forces as they represent the height of the pro-American act of offering south Korea to the U.S. as its permanent advanced base for invading the DPRK and the puppet army as a shock brigade of its master in aggression.
					
					The present chief executive of south Korea regarded it as her "election commitment" to normally push forward "transfer of the above-said right" till 2015 and singled out it as one of the "core tasks of her diplomatic and security policies."
					
					Whenever this issue became a topic of public discussion, the south Korean ruling forces claimed that it would be pressed ahead with as scheduled but, in actuality, clung to coattails of their U.S. master in a bid to defer the transfer. According to press reports, the south Korean authorities have been busy with diplomacy towards their U.S. masters since March last to request them to defer the transfer.
					
					They are working hard to defer the transfer under the pretext of the non-existent "nuclear threat from the north." This is chiefly aimed to escalate an international pressure on the DPRK by winning favor of the U.S. keen on its permanent presence in south Korea and thus realize their long-harbored ambition for invading the north.
					
					The south Korean authorities' pro-U.S. submissive and treacherous moves are nothing but foolish behaviors to serve the purpose of the U.S. scenario to reduce south Korea to its total colony and base for attacking the north.

articles.title: S. Korean Students Protest against IS's Interference in Election
articles.content:
S. Korean Students Protest against IS's Interference in Election
Pyongyang, July 31 (KCNA) -- 255 students of Chonnam University of south Korea held a press conference on July 27 at the university calling for probing the truth behind the interference of the Intelligence Service (IS) in the election and issued a declaration on the situation.
					They noted that the IS's interference in the election is obviously a crime and an act of trampling down the desire of the people for democracy.
					
					The chief executive should be held wholly responsible for the IS's case and the "National Assembly" should properly conduct a state investigation into it, they held.
					
					The declaration called for arresting all those involved in the case.

articles.title: S. Korean Believers Slam IS's Interference in Election
articles.content:
S. Korean Believers Slam IS's Interference in Election
Pyongyang, July 31 (KCNA) -- Believers of the Masan Parish of the south Korean Roman Catholics held a press conference in Masan, Changwon City, South Kyongsang Province on July 29 and issued a declaration on the situation demanding a probe into the truth behind the Intelligence Service's (IS) interference in the election.
					They accused the IS of illegally interfering in the election and the police of releasing the results of false investigation into it to cover up the case.
					
					They said they were stunned by the reckless act of fully opening the minutes of the 2007 south-north summit to public.
					
					All these acts are a challenge and crime in history as they are a criminal act of trampling down democracy, they noted, adding:
					
					The "government" and the "Saenuri Party" are working hard to evade the responsibility, instead of probing the truth behind the illegal case and owning the responsibility for it. This goes to prove that the present regime is a successor to the past military fascist dictatorial regime.
					
					If the ruling forces refuse to own the responsibility for the case of the IS's illegal interference in the election, they will meet the same strong resistance of the people as what happened during the April 19 uprising and the June 10 resistance, the declaration warned.

articles.title: S. Korean Taejon Court Admits Injustice of "Emergency Measure" Taken by Fascist Regime
articles.content:
S. Korean Taejon Court Admits Injustice of "Emergency Measure" Taken by Fascist Regime
Pyongyang, July 31 (KCNA) -- The Taejon District Court of south Korea passed a decision of "not guilty" upon Ri Wan Gyu, who was sentenced to a jail term on an unreasonable charge during the military fascist dictatorial regime 38 years ago.
					A university student in 1975, he was sentenced to a prison term by the "yusin" regime and served a prison term for the mere reason that he sent a letter condemning the dictator's "emergency measure 9".
					
					After the constitutional court ruled in March this year that such a measure was the one of violating the freedom of the people in all aspects, Ri applied for a new trial, claiming his innocence.
					
					The court declared him not guilty.

articles.title: Candlelight Rally Held by Koreans in Germany in Protest against IS's Meddling in Election
articles.content:
Candlelight Rally Held by Koreans in Germany in Protest against IS's Meddling in Election
Pyongyang, July 31 (KCNA) -- Koreans in Germany held a candlelight rally in Berlin on July 27 in protest against the south Korean Intelligence Service's (IS) meddling in the "presidential election".
					They accused the IS of abusing its power in the period of the election in a bid to conduct propaganda representing the interests of a specified party and twisting the will of the people.
					
					They also lashed out at the present conservative ruling forces for desperately working to derail the state investigation for probing truth about the IS's interference in the election.
					
					Such meddling is an illegal action, they noted, urging the present chief executive of south Korea to bear full responsibility for the case and arrest those involved in the case at once.
					
					That day they conducted an information service disclosing the IS's illegal action.

articles.title: Koreans in U.S. Call for Realizing Peace on Korean Peninsula
articles.content:
Koreans in U.S. Call for Realizing Peace on Korean Peninsula
Pyongyang, July 31 (KCNA) -- Members of an organization of Koreans in the U.S. and a U.S. organization of peace campaign against war staged a solidarity demonstration in New York on July 24 calling for the conclusion of a peace treaty on the Korean Peninsula.
					On July 26, other Koreans held a candlelight rally calling for the conclusion of a peace treaty.
					
					The speakers said at the rally that the armistice does not mean the end of the war but its temporary suspension, adding that a peace treaty should be concluded to free the peninsula from the danger of a war. 
					
					They underscored the need to conclude a peace treaty and reunify the country at an early date to put an end to the pain the separated families and relatives are undergoing due to the division of the country.

articles.title: German Expert Calls for UN Reform
articles.content:
German Expert Calls for UN Reform
Pyongyang, July 31 (KCNA) -- Dr. Christof Lehmann, a German expert in international issues, posted on the website NSNBC on July 16 an article calling for changes in the United Nations.
					The article said that despotism has become the order of the day at the UN, referring to the fact that over the recent years the UN Security Council has adopted a series of resolutions on Korea over its satellite launch, in violation of the principles and provisions of the Charter of the UN. 
					
					Any of the permanent members of the UN Security Council possesses nuclear weapons and they themselves are in a situation that allows them to decide what is legitimate for them, it said, and went on:
					
					The UNSC sanctions are designed to starve and impoverish the people of the DPRK by depriving them of the basic rights which the UN purportedly should safeguard, and they are prompted by the specific intention to create inner political tensions as well as tensions between the north and the south of the divided country. 
					
					Korea is a United Nations showcase. Six decades after the signing of the armistice that ended armed hostilities on the Korean Peninsula, Korea shows that the UN is no longer safe to salvage, unless radical and comprehensive changes are made within the end of this decade. 
					
					The UN, as it stands today, is rapidly perverting into an institution by which neo-colonialist powers attempt to sanction their abuse of not-so-privileged nations.
					
					Even a blind man can see that there is no such thing as justice with the UN today. 
					
					The UN functions as agency of conflict. UN justice today is tyranny. 
					
					We, humanity, cannot let this stand.

articles.title: Anniversary of Korean People's Victory in War Celebrated in Various Countries
articles.content:
Anniversary of Korean People's Victory in War Celebrated in Various Countries
Pyongyang, July 31 (KCNA) -- Seminars were held in Russia, Nepal and Mexico from July 20 to 23 to celebrate the 60th anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the great Fatherland Liberation War.
					Displayed in the venues of the seminars were photos documenting the immortal Songun leadership exploits of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					The chairperson of the Maritime Territorial Regional Committee of the A Just Russia said:
					
					Kim Il Sung wisely led the three-year hard-fought Fatherland Liberation War, winning a victory and firmly defending the sovereignty of the DPRK.
					
					It is important to help the younger generation know well about his exploits in the war. We also oppose the U.S.
					
					We hope that the DPRK will emerge victorious in the confrontation with imperialism in future, too, just as it defended socialism despite the U.S. persistent moves to stifle it.
					
					The general secretary of the Central Committee of the Nepal Communist Party (Marxist-Leninist) praised Kim Il Sung as a peerlessly brilliant commander who defeated two formidable imperialisms in one generation.
					
					Speakers including the chairman of the Mexican Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism praised the great Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il for bringing about the beginning of a downhill turn for U.S. imperialism with the Juche-oriented war methods and outstanding commanding art and converting the DPRK into an invincible political, ideological and military power with the Songun politics.
					
					A congratulatory message to the dear respected Kim Jong Un was adopted at the seminar held in Nepal.

articles.title: DPRK's Victory in War Marked in Bulgaria, Czech Republic
articles.content:
DPRK's Victory in War Marked in Bulgaria, Czech Republic
Pyongyang, July 31 (KCNA) -- Public organizations of Bulgaria and the Czech Republic issued bulletins to mark the 60th anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					The Bulgaria-Korea Friendship Association carried in the bulletin on July 23 an article explaining how the Korean War broke out, exposing the crimes of the U.S. imperialists as the provoker of the war and praising the great victory of the Korean people in the war. 
					
					The article continued: President Kim Il Sung led all the Koreans to wage the Fatherland Liberation War to beat back the invasion by the U.S. imperialists and south Korean puppet forces.
					
					The heroic Korean People's Army liberated most parts of south Korea in a short period. At that time the U.S. 24th division which claimed to be invincible was badly battered and Dean, its commander, was taken prisoner.
					
					The Korean army and people scored brilliant military achievements. They killed or injured or captured at least 1 567 000 enemy troops and destructed or captured huge quantities of combat and technical equipment during the war.
					
					The Paektusan Czech-Korean Friendship Association on July 24 published a special bulletin with several articles titled "How did the Korean war break out?" and "60th anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the Fatherland Liberation War".
					
					The articles cited specific facts to prove that the Korean army and people beat back the aggressors and won a historic victory in the war started by the U.S. imperialists, displaying a matchless self-sacrificing spirit and popular heroism.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung Praised for Leading War to Victory
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung Praised for Leading War to Victory
Pyongyang, July 31 (KCNA) -- Various events took place in foreign countries to mark the 60th anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the Fatherland Liberation War from July 18 to 24.
					They included meetings in Argentina and Pakistan and film shows in Thailand and the Czech Republic.
					
					Displayed in the venues of the events were photos documenting the immortal exploits of President Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and the dear respected Kim Jong Un.
					
					Also on display were famous works of the peerlessly great men of Mt. Paektu and some books and pictures introducing Songun Korea.
					
					Participants of the film shows watched Korean films such as "The Country Shining with Arms of Mt. Paektu".
					
					The international secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Argentina praised the President for winning a victory in the war as a brilliant strategist and invincible and iron-willed commander.
					
					The secretary general of the Karachi Branch of the Pakistan-Korea Friendship Association said:
					
					The world witnessed the fierce war fought by the just two years old DPRK against the U.S. which boasted of the myth of "mightiness" early in the 1950s.
					
					The Korean army and people defeated the U.S. imperialists and won a victory in the three-year-long war on July 27, 1953.
					
					We pay highest tribute to the President, who led the war to victory with his extraordinary and seasoned leadership.
					
					The secretary general of the Pakistan Trade Union Federation said:
					
					The Korean war proved that the people are invincible when they fight in unity around the great leader, believing in the justice of their cause.
					
					The U.S. and its allies are making every desperate effort to stifle the DPRK, instead of drawing a lesson from their past heavy defeat.
					
					The U.S. should roll back its hostile policy towards the DPRK.
					
					A congratulatory message to Kim Jong Un was adopted at the meeting in Pakistan.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung Praised in Uruguay, India
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung Praised in Uruguay, India
Pyongyang, July 31 (KCNA) -- The Uruguayan and Indian newspapers each dedicated one whole page to special write-ups interwoven with photos on the undying revolutionary exploits of President Kim Il Sung to mark the 60th anniversary of the victory in the Fatherland Liberation War. 
					The Uruguayan paper La Juventud on July 23 carried an article "Peerless commander who worked military miracles in 20th century" which said:
					
					Kim Il Sung was a peerless commander who created unique military strategy, tactics and war methods which no other famous general could conceive and successfully applied them, working miracles in the modern war history. 
					
					The U.S. imperialists started the invasion of the DPRK on June 25, 1950 and bombastically said the destiny of Korea would be decided in 72 hours. 
					
					However, when the war started, the Korean People's Army repelled the invasion by the enemies with a prompt counterattack and liberated almost all areas of south Korea by ceaseless strikes, baffling the imagination of the world people. 
					
					This unprecedented miracle was the precious result of the outstanding strategy, tactics and leadership of the President. 
					
					The Indian paper New Delhi Times on July 17 in an article titled "Iron-willed commander" praised the immortal exploits of the peerlessly great man who worked an unprecedented historic miracle by defeating the U.S. imperialists who boasted of being the "strongest" in the world. 
					
					The Indian paper Indian and World Event on July 22 in an article "Generalissimo Kim Il Sung" praised him for beating back the two formidable imperialist enemies in one generation. His undying exploits performed in the war will go down in the world history of the anti-imperialist struggle, it added.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung Praised by Thai Organizations
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung Praised by Thai Organizations
Pyongyang, July 31 (KCNA) -- Thai organizations issued statements on July 24 on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of the victory in the great Fatherland Liberation War.
					The Thailand-DPRK Friendship Association said that July 27 marks the 60th anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the Fatherland Liberation War. It went on:
					
					President Kim Il Sung achieved the country's liberation from the Japanese imperialists who kept Korea under their military occupation in the first half of the last century, defeated the U.S. imperialists who boasted of being "the strongest" in the world in the Korean war and demonstrated the country's sovereignty and dignity before the whole world.
					
					Kim Il Sung victoriously led the fierce confrontation with the U.S. imperialists in the post-war period, too, converting the DPRK into an invincible socialist power.
					
					His great exploits in the war will shine forever in the world history of anti- imperialist struggle.
					
					The Organization for the Study of the Juche Idea of Thailand said that an event baffling human imagination took place in the East 60 years ago. It went on:
					
					The U.S. only sustained a lot of material and manpower losses in the three-year Korean war ignited by it and was compelled to sign the Armistice Agreement little short of an instrument of surrender in the eyes of the world on July 27, 1953.
					
					The brilliant victory of the Korean people in the war was a fruition of the wise leadership of Kim Il Sung, an outstanding strategist and eternal President of the DPRK.
					
					There is no such leader of world stature as Kim Il Sung and he will be unparalleled in the future, too.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Report at March Plenary Meeting of C.C., WPK Carried by Zambian Newspaper
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Report at March Plenary Meeting of C.C., WPK Carried by Zambian Newspaper
Pyongyang, July 31 (KCNA) -- The Zambian newspaper Post on July 24 carried the historic report made by the dear respected Kim Jong Un at the March, 2013 Plenary Meeting of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK).
					The report made by him on March 31, Juche 102 (2013) clarifies the new strategic line on simultaneously pushing forward economic construction and the building of nuclear force as required by the prevailing situation and the developing Korean revolution. It also indicates the tasks and ways for doing so.
					
					The paper carried his photo.

articles.title: Korean People's Struggle Supported by Argentine Political Party
articles.content:
Korean People's Struggle Supported by Argentine Political Party
Pyongyang, July 31 (KCNA) -- The Communist Party of Argentina issued a statement on July 20 on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the great Fatherland Liberation War.
					The statement said that the struggle of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) and the Korean people for the country's prosperity and its reunification has become an example to be followed by humankind in the struggle for independence, freedom and social progress. 
					
					It went on:
					
					We support the WPK and the Korean people in their struggle for building a thriving socialist nation and defending the national sovereignty and dignity.
					
					We send congratulations to the Korean people on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of their victory in the great Fatherland Liberation War fought against the aggression by U.S. imperialism and its allies.
					
					We support the WPK's line on simultaneously pushing forward economic construction and the building of the nuclear force laid down at the March, 2013 Plenary Meeting of its Central Committee.
					
					We vehemently denounce the U.S. hostile policy toward the DPRK.
					
					The statement called on the world progressive parties, organizations and figures to pay deep attention to the issue of Korea's reunification and send support and encouragement to the Korean people in their struggle for achieving the country's independent and peaceful reunification without any foreign interference according to President Kim Il Sung's proposal for founding the Democratic Federal Republic of Koryo.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un envia alimentos de cumpleanos a Pyon Jang Phae
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un envia alimentos de cumpleanos a Pyon Jang Phae
Pyongyang, 31 de julio (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un envio los alimentos de 100o cumpleanos a la anciana Pyon Jang Phae, residente en la comunidad obrera de Suphung del distrito de Sakju de la provincia de Phyong-an del Norte.
					Nacida como hija de un campesino arrendatario, antes de la liberacion de Corea, vivio sometida a los maltratos y humillaciones de todo tipo que se imponen al pueblo colonizado.
					
					Comenzo a vivir dignamente despues de la liberacion del pais por el Presidente Kim Il Sung.
					
					Trabajo con sinceridad para recompensar las benevolencias del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y vive sana ahora bajo el sistema de salud publica socialista.
					
					Encomienda a sus descendientes trabajar mucho mas por el pais diciendoles que su longevidad se debe a la atencion del partido.

articles.title: Pak Pong Ju en el distrito de Songchon
articles.content:
Pak Pong Ju en el distrito de Songchon
Pyongyang, 31 de julio (ACNC) -- El premier coreano Pak Pong Ju estuvo en el distrito de Songchon de la provincia de Phyong-an del Sur para informarse de las gestiones de agricultura local. 
					En su recorrido por la Granja Cooperativa de la cabeza distrital de Songchon, estimulo a los agricultores locales que trabajan con esfuerzos redoblados por aumentar la produccion agricola pese a las desfavorables condiciones de la estacion de lluvias. 
					
					Luego, el premier convoco una reunion de consulta. 
					
					En la ocasion fueron enumerados los exitos alcanzados por la granja con vistas al aumento de produccion de cereales y tomadas las medidas de trabajo para elevar el rendimiento por hectarea. 
					
					Por otra parte, Pak se cercioro del estado de cultivo de la Granja Cooperativa de Taebong y apunto que los trabajadores agricolas deben cumplir con su mision de responsabilizarse por los cultivos agricolas. 
					
					Al enterarse del estado de abonamiento, insistio en producir mucho mas abonos organicos de buena calidad, echarlos en las parcelas y fomentar la superioridad del sistema de autoadministracion por subgrupo para elevar el entusiasmo de los agricultores y aumentar la produccion.

articles.title: Gremiales de UMDC celebran aniversario 67 de ley de igualdad
articles.content:
Gremiales de UMDC celebran aniversario 67 de ley de igualdad
Pyongyang, 31 de julio (ACNC) -- En ocasion del 67o aniversario de la promulgacion de la ley de igualdad de los derechos del hombre y la mujer, tuvieron lugar los dias 30 y 31 en la Zona de Recreo de Moranbong los juegos folcloricos y de diversiones de las miembros de la Union de Mujeres Democraticas de Corea provenientes de todo el pais.
					En la ocasion estuvieron presentes la presidenta del CC de la UMDC, Ro Song Sil, las funcionarias de esta organizacion y las gremiales de esta ciudad y otras provincias.
					
					Las disciplinas fueron el Yut (juego folclorico coreano), el salto en columpio y el sobre balancin.
					
					A traves de los juegos folcloricos y de diversiones, las participantes demostraron el impetu revolucionario de las mujeres coreanas de glorificar las imperecederas hazanas de los Grandes Generalisimos acumuladas para el desarrollo del autoctono movimiento de mujeres y cumplir con sus deberes en la ofensiva general por la construccion del Estado prospero socialista siguiendo la orientacion del Songun del Mariscal Kim Jong Un.
					
					El grupo de la ciudad de Pyongyang ocupo el primer lugar y hubo la premiacion.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun condena solicitud surcoreana de posponer el traspaso de mando militar
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun condena solicitud surcoreana de posponer el traspaso de mando militar
Pyongyang, 31 de julio (ACNC) -- Hace poco, un medio surcoreano informo que el ministro titere surcoreano de Defensa Nacional, Kim Kwan Jin, propuso oficialmente en las conversaciones con su par norteamericano, sostenidas en junio pasado, posponer el tiempo de traslado de Estados Unidos al Sur de Corea del mando de operaciones en el tiempo de guerra.
					El circulo militar surcoreano confirmo que ha propuesto a EE.UU. debatir ese asunto en la "reunion consultiva anual de seguridad" Sur de Corea-EE.UU. que se abrira en octubre.
					
					El diario Rodong Sinmun, en un comentario individual difundido este miercoles, senala que eso significa el climax de actos vendepatrias proyanquis orientados a convertir el territorio surcoreano en la base avanzada de EE.UU. para la eventual agresion al Norte de Corea y a hacer del ejercito titere surcoreano la brigada de choque al mando del imperio.
					
					Igualmente, deja conocer claramente la naturaleza antinacional de los gobernantes surcoreanos que tratan de enfrentarse hasta el final con la connacional RPDC en contubernio con las fuerzas extranjeras, critica el comentarista y prosigue:
					
					La actual gobernante surcoreana presento como su "promesa electoral" por la presidencia la "promocion segun lo programado del traspaso del mando de operaciones en el tiempo de guerra" hasta el ano 2015 y lo planteo como "tarea nuclear de su politica diplomatica y de seguridad".
					
					De acuerdo con un despacho, las actuales autoridades surcoreanas vinieron suplicando desde marzo a EE.UU. el aplazamiento de traspaso del mando faltando a su promesa electoral.
					
					Esa solicitud argumentada con la inexistente "amenaza nuclear del Norte de Corea" persigue recrudecer la ofensiva internacional anti-RPDC congraciandose con EE.UU., que intenta la ocupacion perpetua del Sur de Corea, y realizar a la larga su anejada ambicion de agredir al Norte de Corea.
					
					Asi los titeres surcoreanos favorecen la estratagema de EE.UU. que pretende colonizar eternamente al Sur de Corea y usarlo como base de ataque contra la RPDC.
